classes.title: LGLA401
classes.subtitle: Elementary Lingala I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces the essential elements of Lingala structure and vocabulary and aspects of African cultures. Aural comprehension, reading, speaking, and writing are stressed.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: LGLA402
classes.subtitle: Elementary Lingala II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces the essential elements of Lingala structure and vocabulary and aspects of African cultures. Aural comprehension, reading, speaking, and writing are stressed.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: LGLA402
classes.subtitle: Elementary Lingala II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Continues the introduction of the essential elements of Lingala structure and vocabulary and aspects of African cultures. Aural comprehension, reading, speaking, and writing are stressed.Requisites: Prerequisite, LGLA�401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: LGLA403
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Lingala III.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Continues the introduction of the essential elements of Lingala structure and vocabulary and aspects of African cultures. Aural comprehension, reading, speaking, and writing are stressed.Requisites: Prerequisite, LGLA�401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: LGLA403
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Lingala III.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This courses increases language learning ability, communicative proficiency, and proficiency in the cultures of the Lingala-speaking people.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: LGLA404
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Lingala IV.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This courses increases language learning ability, communicative proficiency, and proficiency in the cultures of the Lingala-speaking people.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: LGLA404
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Lingala IV.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course reinforces language learning ability, communicative proficiency in the culture of the Lingala-speaking people through gradual exposure to more challenging tasks, with emphasis on poetry and prose reading, and creative writing.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.
